page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: Our study area is situated in the Vale of Clwyd in North Wales. It is a wide valley bordered to the west by the Hiraethog Mountains and to the east by the Clwydian Hills.The area extends from the River Clwyd on the floor of the valley almost to the highest point of the Hills on the easern side. It is a rural area with many farms and small villages. A large section is moorland which rises to a height of over 1800 feet.The village of Gellifor is the focal point where most of the people live. The only other village is the hamlet called Hirwaun. The area is crossed by narrow country lanes, only a few of which are suitable for heavy transport. Gellifor lies about three miles north west of Ruthin and six miles south west of Denbigh.
